author: Satish Nandgaonkar
text:
The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has once against sought permission from the Maharashtra government to prosecute former Congress Chief Minister Ashok Chavan in connection with the Adarsh housing society scam.

The CBI made the request to Maharashtra governor Ch Vidyasagar Rao seeking permission to prosecute Mr. Chavan in the scam a few days ago.

Sources said when the Governor consulted the State government, the Devendra Fadnavis cabinet gave its consent to launch proceedings against Mr. Chavan.

Interestingly, the development came a day after State Advocate General Srihari Aney had a meeting with the Governor at Raj Bhavan. The meeting was described as a “courtesy call” by Raj Bhavan sources.

‘CBI misused’

Reacting to the development, Mr. Chavan, who heads the Maharashtra Pradesh Congress Committee, said it was another example of “vendetta politics” by the BJP government against Congress leaders.

“This is part of the vendetta politics of the BJP governments at the Centre and State towards the Congress party and Congress leaders. This is a conspiracy to take revenge against the Congress party. The CBI is being misused for this, and seeking permission from the Maharashtra Governor to prosecute me is the latest example of this,” he said.
title: CBI seeks fresh nod to prosecute Ashok Chavan
